source:
# Check for new, updated or deleted data
- This script checks for new, updated or deleted data by checking the source data (sap hr) against the target (odw_harmonised_db.personnelarea_dim)
- **New Data:** where a PA in the source does not exist as an PersonnelAreaCode in the target. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Updated data:** Comparison occurs on PA in source and PersonnelAreaCode in target where the row hash is different i.e. there is a change in one of the columns. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Deleted data:** where an PersonnelAreaCode in the target exists but the same PA doesn't exist in the source. DeletedData flag is set to 'Y'

## View personnelarea_dim_new is created

%%sql

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW personnelarea_grouped

    AS

SELECT PA, Personnel_Area

FROM odw_standardised_db.vw_saphr

WHERE PA IS NOT NULL

GROUP BY PA, Personnel_Area;

select * from personnelarea_grouped;

%%sql
-- Build personnelarea_dim table
-- Gets modified or deleted from source rows

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW personnelarea_dim_new

    AS

-- gets data that matches of SourceID and flags that it is modified based on a row (md5) hash. Flags as "NewData"
-- gets data that is in the target but not in source. Flags as "DeletedData"

SELECT 
    CASE
        WHEN T1.PA IS NULL
        THEN first(T7.PersonnelAreaID)
        ELSE NULL
    END as PersonnelAreaID, -- surrogate key
    CASE
        WHEN T1.PA IS NULL
        THEN first(T7.PersonnelAreaCode)
        ELSE T1.PA
    END as PersonnelAreaCode, -- source system id
    Personnel_Area AS Description, 
    First(T2.SourceSystemID) as SourceSystemID,
    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP AS StartDate,
    NULL AS EndDate,
    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP AS IngestionDate,
    NULL AS ValidTo,
    md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.PA, '.'), IFNULL(T1.Personnel_Area,'.'))) as RowID,
    'Y' as IsActive,
    CASE
        WHEN T1.PA = first(T7.PersonnelAreaCode) AND  md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.PA, '.'), IFNULL(T1.Personnel_Area,'.'))) <> first(T7.RowID)    -- same employee, changed data
        THEN 'Y'
        WHEN first(T7.PersonnelAreaCode) IS NULL -- new employee
        THEN 'Y'
        ELSE 'N'
    END as NewData,
    CASE
        WHEN T1.PA IS NULL
        THEN 'Y'
        ELSE 'N'
    END AS  DeletedData

FROM personnelarea_grouped T1
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.sourcesystem_fact T2 ON "SAP HR" = T2.Description
FULL JOIN odw_harmonised_db.personnelarea_dim T7 ON T1.PA = T7.PersonnelAreaCode
WHERE  (T7.IsActive = 'Y' or T7.IsActive IS NULL)
    
        AND (
        
        -- flags new data        
        ( CASE
            WHEN T1.PA = T7.PersonnelAreaCode AND md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.PA, '.'), IFNULL(T1.Personnel_Area,'.'))) <> T7.RowID    -- same employee, changed data
            THEN 'Y'
            WHEN T7.PersonnelAreaCode IS NULL -- new employee
            THEN 'Y'
            ELSE 'N'
        END  = 'Y' ) OR
        
        -- flags deleted data
        ( CASE
            WHEN T1.PA IS NULL
            THEN 'Y'
            ELSE 'N'
        END = 'Y' )
)

    -- AND

    --     T1.PA IS NOT NULL


GROUP BY T1.PA, T1.Personnel_Area
;

SELECT * FROM personnelarea_dim_new;

from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()

Source_Number_PAreas = spark.sql("SELECT COUNT (DISTINCT PA) AS Source_Number_PAreas FROM odw_standardised_db.vw_saphr")
Source_PAreas = spark.sql("SELECT DISTINCT PA AS Source_PAreas FROM odw_standardised_db.vw_saphr")
Current_Number_PAreas = spark.sql("SELECT COUNT (DISTINCT PersonnelAreaCode) AS Current_Number_PAreas FROM odw_harmonised_db.personnelarea_dim where IsActive = 'Y' ")
Current_PAreas = spark.sql("SELECT DISTINCT PersonnelAreaCode AS Current_Number_PAreas FROM odw_harmonised_db.personnelarea_dim where IsActive = 'Y' ")
New_Data_Number = spark.sql("SELECT COUNT (DISTINCT PersonnelAreaCode) AS New_Data_Number FROM personnelarea_dim_new WHERE NewData = 'Y'")
New_Data_Records = spark.sql("SELECT DISTINCT PersonnelAreaCode AS New_Data_Records FROM personnelarea_dim_new WHERE NewData = 'Y'")
Deleted_Data_Number = spark.sql("SELECT COUNT (DISTINCT PersonnelAreaCode) AS Deleted_Data_Number FROM personnelarea_dim_new WHERE DeletedData = 'Y'")
Deleted_Data_Records = spark.sql("SELECT COUNT (DISTINCT PersonnelAreaCode) AS Deleted_Data_Records FROM personnelarea_dim_new WHERE DeletedData = 'Y'")
Existing_PAreas = spark.sql("SELECT DISTINCT PA AS Existing_PAreas FROM odw_standardised_db.vw_saphr T1 RIGHT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.personnelarea_dim T7 ON T1.PA = T7.PersonnelAreaCode")

# SELECT * FROM personnelarea_dim_new;

Source_Number_PAreas_Pandas = Source_Number_PAreas.toPandas()
Source_PAreas_Pandas =  Source_PAreas.toPandas()
Current_Number_PAreas_Pandas =  Current_Number_PAreas.toPandas()
Current_PAreas_Pandas =  Current_PAreas.toPandas()
New_Data_Number_Pandas = New_Data_Number.toPandas()
New_Data_Records_Pandas = New_Data_Records.toPandas()
Deleted_Data_Number_Pandas = Deleted_Data_Number.toPandas()
Deleted_Data_Records_Pandas = Deleted_Data_Records.toPandas()
Existing_PAreas_Pandas = Existing_PAreas.toPandas()

print(Source_Number_PAreas_Pandas)
print(Source_PAreas_Pandas)
print(Current_Number_PAreas_Pandas)
print(Current_PAreas_Pandas)
print(New_Data_Number_Pandas)
print(New_Data_Records_Pandas)
print(Deleted_Data_Number_Pandas)
print(Deleted_Data_Records_Pandas)
print(Existing_PAreas_Pandas)

# Source_Number_PAreas_Pandas.printSchema()

# to turn a column to a list in a pandas dataframe, i think isolate the column first with 

Total_Number = Source_Number_PAreas_Pandas['Source_Number_PAreas'].tolist() 
Current_Loaded_Number = Current_Number_PAreas_Pandas['Current_Number_PAreas'].tolist() 
New_Data_Number = New_Data_Number_Pandas['New_Data_Number'].tolist() 
Deleted_Data_Number = Deleted_Data_Number_Pandas['Deleted_Data_Number'].tolist() 

print(Total_Number)
print(Total_Number[0])
print(Current_Loaded_Number)
print(New_Data_Number)
print(Deleted_Data_Number)
print(Current_Loaded_Number[0] + New_Data_Number[0] - Deleted_Data_Number[0])

# if Total_Number[0] <> Current_Loaded_Number[0] + New_Data_Number[0] - Deleted_Data_Number[0]:
#     raise 'Loading Number do not match'

# Dataset is created that contains changed data and corresponding target data
- This script combines data that has been updated, Deleted or is new, with corresponding target data
- View **personnelarea_dim_new** is unioned to the target data filter to only those rows where changes have been detected
## View personnelarea_dim_changed_rows is created

%%sql
-- Creating new and updated dataset

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW personnelarea_dim_changed_rows

    AS

SELECT 
    PersonnelAreaID,
    PersonnelAreaCode,
    Description, 
    SourceSystemID,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM personnelarea_dim_new

    UNION ALL

SELECT
    PersonnelAreaID,
    PersonnelAreaCode,
    Description,
    SourceSystemID,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.personnelarea_dim
WHERE PersonnelAreaCode IN (SELECT PersonnelAreaCode FROM personnelarea_dim_new);

# View personnelarea_dim_changed_rows is used in a merge (Upsert) statement into the target table
- **WHEN MATCHED** ON the Business Key (i.e. PA from SAPHR), EndDate is set to today -1 day and the IsActive flag is set to 'N'
- **WHEN NOT MATCHED** ON the business key, insert rows
## Table odw_harmonised.personnelarea_dim is updated

%%sql

-- merge into fact table

MERGE INTO odw_harmonised_db.personnelarea_dim AS Target
USING personnelarea_dim_changed_rows AS Source

ON Source.PersonnelAreaID = Target.PersonnelAreaID

-- For Updates existing rows

WHEN MATCHED
    THEN 
    UPDATE SET
    Target.EndDate = date_sub(current_timestamp,1),
    Target.IsActive = 'N'

-- Insert completely new rows
WHEN NOT MATCHED 
    THEN INSERT * ;

# Fix the IDs
- No auto-increment feature is available in delta tables, therefore we need to create new IDs for the inserted rows
- This is done by select the target data and using INSERT OVERWRITE to re-insert the data is a new Row Number
## Table odw_harmonised.personnelarea_dim is updated

%%sql
-- Insert new PersonnelAreaID

INSERT OVERWRITE odw_harmonised_db.personnelarea_dim

SELECT 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY PersonnelAreaID NULLS LAST) AS PersonnelAreaID,
    PersonnelAreaCode,
    Description, 
    SourceSystemID,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.personnelarea_dim;
